description: The Mukhyamantri Alpasankhyak Udyami Yojana in Bihar promotes entrepreneurship among minority communities by providing financial assistance and training to establish micro-enterprises, fostering economic inclusion and self-reliance.

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to Rs. 10 Lakhs per beneficiary, with 50% subsidy and 50% interest-free loan

community_criteria: Must belong to a notified minority community (Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, Parsi)
residency_criteria: Must be a resident of Bihar
business_criteria: Proposed business must be viable and sustainable

eligible_activities: Setting up micro-enterprises in manufacturing, services, or retail
Purchase of equipment, raw materials, or infrastructure

steps: Visit the Bihar Industries Department portal or scheme website
Register and submit an online application with a business plan
Upload required documents, including minority certificate and residency proof
Applications are reviewed by a district-level committee
Approved beneficiaries receive funds and training
application_process.note: Applicants must complete mandatory training before fund disbursement

special_notes: The loan component is interest-free and repayable over 5 years
Priority is given to innovative and sustainable business ideas
Beneficiaries are monitored for proper fund utilization
